toc_entry.title: On the Waterfront
toc_entry.description: A celebration of sailors’ dives, longshoremen’s vendettas, refineries, factories, giant ships, and fifty miles of dirty water.

toc_entry.title: You Can See By My Outfit That I Am A Cowboy
toc_entry.description: If you get an outfit you can be a cowboy, too.

toc_entry.title: A Guide For Dudes
toc_entry.description: Yes, friends, at these dude ranches the wild West still lives.

toc_entry.title: Brave New Vacancies
toc_entry.description: Give us your tired and freezing Yankees, your studious Arabs, your ambitious young hustlers just blown into town, and we will rent them one bedroom and a bath for $215.

toc_entry.title: The Last Sister
toc_entry.description: Modern nuns have left the convent and entered the world. If they don’t like what they find, can they go home again?

toc_entry.title: Just Baby And Me
toc_entry.subtitle: Lifestyles
toc_entry.description: A mother’s job offers no vacations, no holidays, and lousy pay, but it’s a noble profession.

toc_entry.title: Building Fever
toc_entry.subtitle: Country Notes
toc_entry.description: It’s a chicken coop. I built it myself.

toc_entry.title: Asset Hound
toc_entry.subtitle: Dealing
toc_entry.description: When Rusty Rose talks, people with money listen.

toc_entry.title: Tots And Pans
toc_entry.subtitle: Dining In
toc_entry.description: So your kids struck out in baseball, tripped up in tap, and camp won’t take them back this summer? Try teaching them to cook.

toc_entry.title: A Little Spring Madness
toc_entry.subtitle: Theater
toc_entry.description: Maybe there’s no cure for insanity, but two new plays offer some provocative treatments.

toc_entry.title: The Seven-Year Hitch
toc_entry.subtitle: Classical Music
toc_entry.description: Conducting the Houston Symphony, Lawrence Foster inspired respect. He didn’t know he needed love, too.

toc_entry.title: Fiddler On the Loose
toc_entry.subtitle: Popular Music
toc_entry.description: Back in the forties Gatemouth Brown took Texas blues uptown. Now he’s taking C&W to New Orleans.

toc_entry.title: Hullabaloo In Ragtime
toc_entry.subtitle: Dance
toc_entry.description: Mix together Scott Joplin, modern history, and the Prodigal Son and what do you get? A mess of pottage.

toc_entry.title: Rhythm ’N’ Hues
toc_entry.subtitle: Art
toc_entry.description: Riding a color merry-go-round with America’s first modern painters.

toc_entry.title: Behind the Lines
toc_entry.description: The uselessness of college.

toc_entry.title: The Inside Story
toc_entry.description: Horsefeathers and other plumage.

toc_entry.title: The Roar Of the Crowd
toc_entry.description: The rich and the powerless.

toc_entry.title: Touts
toc_entry.description: Frock and roll.

toc_entry.title: Around the State
toc_entry.description: A selective guide to entertainment and events of more than usual interest.

toc_entry.title: the Texas Monthly Reporter
toc_entry.description: Psychiatrists send men to death row; Texas’ loop coasters give upside-down joyride; Diablos play baseball with Kleenex and kazoos.

toc_entry.title: Contest
toc_entry.description: Sound waves
